de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.support
Class ExecutionRunner

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.support.ExecutionRunner
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ExecutionRunner
extends java.lang.Thread

The ExecutionRunner will fork into a new thread. It is the link between execution GUI and the virtual machine. Basically, the ExecutionComposite initializes the ExecutionRunner, which then sets up the virtual machine and controls it. By doing so, it is possible to pause and halt applications. The ExecutionRunner will also periodically supply statistical information to the ExecutionWindow.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-08-28
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Constructor Detail

ExecutionRunner

public ExecutionRunner(ExecutionComposite executionComposite,
                       MugglClassLoader classLoader,
                       ClassFile classFile,
                       Method method,
                       int refreshEvery)
Initialize the ExecutionRunner.

Parameters:
executionComposite - The corresponding stepByStepExecutionComposite.
classLoader - The system MugglClassLoader.
classFile - The ClassFile which is executed first.
method - The method which is executed first.
refreshEvery - The period in miliseconds after which the ExecutionWindow is refreshed.
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Fork into a new thread and set up the execution. Then start the main execution loop. It will block until execution is started by the ExecutionWindow. It then continous to update the ExecutionWindow with information until execution is either finished or aborted.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

startExecution

public void startExecution()
Start the execution.

pauseExecution

public void pauseExecution()
Pause the execution.

resumeExecution

public void resumeExecution()
Resume the execution.

abortExecution

public void abortExecution()
If an Application has been initialized, invoke its method to abort the execution.

stopExecutionDueToLimitations

public void stopExecutionDueToLimitations()
If an Application has been initialized, invoke its method to abort the execution but do not display a message about the abortion. If the execution mode was symbolical, try to generate test cases.

getApplication

public Application getApplication()
Getter for the Application.

Returns:
The Application generated by this ExectionRunner.
